name: Indicate the data value in the containing model is a change from a previous instance of the same model
description: Takes a value from the valueset listed in the model to indicate the data value in the containing model is a change from a previous instance of the same model.

element.short: Indicate the data value in the containing model is a change from a previous instance of the same model
element.definition: Takes a value from the valueset listed in the model to indicate the data value in the containing model is a change from a previous instance of the same model.
element.comments: This model is intended to constrain values from OBX-8 in a lab result HL7 message. Because OBX-8 is overloaded to contain multiple types of data, we need a way to tell which kind of code is sent (abnormal flag, delta flag, or ordinal interpretation.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.comments: This model is intended to constrain values from OBX-8 in a lab result HL7 message. Because OBX-8 is overloaded to contain multiple types of data, we need a way to tell which kind of code is sent (abnormal flag, delta flag, or ordinal interpretation.
